metatype.name: RMI Server Port

metatype.description: name of the JAAS realm used for authentication

metatype.name: Service Url

metatype.description: whether any threads started for the JMXConnectorServer should be started as daemon threads
metatype.name: Daemon

metatype.description: whether the JMXConnectorServer should be started in a separate thread
metatype.name: Threaded

metatype.description: the ObjectName used to register the JMXConnectorServer
metatype.name: ObjectName

metatype.description: whether to start MBean server with SSL
metatype.name: Secured

metatype.description: Number of milliseconds waiting for keystore to be loaded.
metatype.name: KeyStore Availability Timeout

metatype.description: Algorithm to use
metatype.name: Secure Algorithm

metatype.description: Protocol to use
metatype.name: Secure Protocol

metatype.description: Keystore name from keystore manager
metatype.name: Keystore Name

metatype.description: Key alias to be used with secured connector
metatype.name: Key Alias

metatype.description: Truststore name from keystore manager
metatype.name: Truststore Name

metatype.description: Authenticator to use. Available values are "none", "password", and "certificate".
metatype.name: Authenticator Type

metatype.description: port of the SSH daemon
metatype.name: SSH Port

metatype.description: name of the host used to bind the SSH daemon
metatype.name: SSH Host

metatype.description: name of the JAAS realm to use for SSH authentication
metatype.name: SSH Realm

metatype.description: location of the host key for SSH
metatype.name: Host key

metatype.description: Secret key size in 1024, 2048, 3072, or 4096
metatype.name: Key size

metatype.description: Host key algorithm in DSA, RSA, etc
metatype.name: Key algorithm

metatype.description: The size of the thread pool. The default value is 10. Increase in case of a large amount of synchronous events where the event handler services in turn send new synchronous events in the event dispatching thread or a lot of timeouts are to be expected. A value of less then 2 triggers the default value. A value of 2 effectively disables thread pooling.
metatype.name: Thread Pool Size

metatype.description: The black-listing timeout in milliseconds. The default value is 5000. Increase or decrease at own discretion. A value of less then 100 turns timeouts off. Any other value is the time in milliseconds granted to each event handler before it gets blacklisted
metatype.name: Timeout

metatype.description: Are event handlers required to be registered with a topic? This is enabled by default. The specification says that event handlers must register with a list of topics they are interested in. Disabling this setting will enable that handlers without a topic are receiving all events (i.e., they are treated the same as with a topic=*).
metatype.name: Require Topic

metatype.description: Configure event handlers to be called without a timeout. If a timeout is configured by default all event handlers are called using the timeout. For performance optimization it is possible to configure event handlers where the timeout handling is not used - this reduces the thread usage from the thread pools as the timout handling requires an additional thread to call the event handler. However, the application should work without this configuration property. It is a pure optimization! The value is a list of strings. If a string ends with a dot, all handlers in exactly this package are ignored. If the string ends with a star, all handlers in this package and all subpackages are ignored. If the string neither ends with a dot nor with a star, this is assumed to define an exact class name.
metatype.name: Ignore Timeouts

metatype.description: realm.description
metatype.name: realm.name

value.name: Apache Felix Web Console Event Plugin

metatype.description: The maximum number of events displayed in the plugin.
metatype.name: Maximum Events

metatype.description: the directory used as a storage for configurations
metatype.name: Storage directory

metatype.description: Max value a data sample can be for any metric (used to suppress spike data on metrics graphs)
metatype.name: Metrics Max Threshold

metatype.description: Default protocol to use for services.
metatype.name: Protocol

metatype.description: The host name or IP address used to advertise the system. Possibilities include the address of a single node of that of a load balancer in a multi-node deployment. NOTE: This setting will take effect after a system restart.
metatype.name: Host

metatype.description: The port used to advertise the system. Possibilities include the port of a single node of that of a load balancer in a multi-node deployment. NOTE: This setting will take effect after a system restart.
metatype.name: Port

metatype.description: Trust Store location. Path is relative to ddf.home - for default (development-only) trust store, use etc/keystores/serverTruststore.jks.
metatype.name: Trust Store:

metatype.description: Trust Store password
metatype.name: Trust Store Password:

metatype.description: Key Store location. Path is relative to ddf.home - for default (development-only) key store, use etc/keystores/serverKeystore.jks.
metatype.name: Key Store:

metatype.description: Key Store password.
metatype.name: Key Store Password:

metatype.description: Sets a limit on the number of results this sorted federation strategy can handle from each federated source. A large start index          in conjunction with several federated sources could yield a large result set, which the sorted federation strategy has a limited ability to do.           The admin can make a rough calculation to decide what maximum start index to use based on the amount of memory in the system, the amount of          federated sources, the number of threads, and the expected amount of query results requested          ( (average # of threads) * (maximum # of federated sources) * (maxStartIndex + maximumQueryResults) ) must fit into the allocated memory of          the running distribution.  This field will be removed when sorted federation strategy has the ability to sort a larger amount of results.
metatype.name: Maximum start index
Federation Thread Pool Size (0 for unlimited)

metatype.description: Specifies the directory to use for the content repository. A shutdown of the server is necessary for this property to take effect. If a filepath is provided with directories that don't exist, File System Provider will attempt to create them. Out of the box (without configuration), the content repository is <INSTALL_DIR>/content/store.
metatype.name: Content Repository File Path

metatype.description: STS WSDL Address
metatype.name: STS WSDL Address:

metatype.description: STS Endpoint Name.
metatype.name: STS Endpoint Name:

metatype.description: STS Service Name.
metatype.name: STS Service Name:

metatype.description: Path to Signature crypto properties. This path can be part of the classpath, relative to ddf.home, or an absolute path on the system.
metatype.name: Signature Properties:

metatype.description: Path to Encryption crypto properties file. This path can be part of the classpath, relative to ddf.home, or an absolute path on the system.
metatype.name: Encryption Properties:

metatype.description: Path to STS crypto properties file. This path can be part of the classpath, relative to ddf.home, or an absolute path on the system.
metatype.name: STS Properties:

metatype.description: Comma-delimited list of claims that should be requested by the STS.
metatype.name: Claims:

metatype.description: Specifies the directory to use for data storage. A shutdown of the server is necessary for this property to take effect. If a filepath is provided with directories that don't exist, Solr Catalog Provider (SCP) will attempt to create those directories. Out of the box (without configuration), this Solr Catalog Provider writes to <DISTRIBUTION_INSTALLATION_DIRECTORY>/data/solr. It is recommended to use an absolute filepath to minimize confusion such as /opt/solr_data in Linux or C:/solr_data in Windows.
metatype.name: Data Directory File Path

metatype.description: WARNING: Performance Impact.  Only in special cases should auto-commit be forced. Forcing auto-commit makes the search results visible immediately.
metatype.name: Force Auto Commit

metatype.description: Disables the ability to make Text Path queries by disabling the Text Path index. Disabling Text Path indexing typically increases ingest performance.
metatype.name: Disable Text Path indexing

metatype.description: Specifies the header text to be rendered on the generated Query Page
metatype.name: Header

metatype.description: Specifies the footer text to be rendered on the generated Query Page
metatype.name: Footer

metatype.description: Specifies the Text Color of the Header and Footer.  Use html css colors or #rrggbb.
metatype.name: Text Color

metatype.description: Specifies the Background Color of the Header and Footer.  Use html css colors or #rrggbb.
metatype.name: Background Color

metatype.description: Specifies the redirect URI to use when accessing the /search URI.
metatype.name: Redirect URI

configurations.bundle_name: DDF :: UI :: Search UI :: Application Redirect
configurations.name: Search UI Redirect

value.name: Apache Felix Jetty Based Http Service

metatype.description: Whether or not HTTP is enabled. Defaults to true thus HTTP enabled.
metatype.name: Enable HTTP

metatype.description: Port to listen on for HTTP requests. Defaults to 8080.
metatype.name: HTTP Port

metatype.description: Wether or not to use NIO for HTTP. Defaults to true. Only used if HTTP is enabled.
metatype.name: NIO for HTTP

metatype.description: Whether or not HTTPS is enabled. Defaults to false thus HTTPS disabled.
metatype.name: Enable HTTPS

metatype.description: Port to listen on for HTTPS requests. Defaults to 433.
metatype.name: HTTPS Port

metatype.description: Wether or not to use NIO for HTTP. Defaults to the value of the NIO for HTTP property. Only used if HTTPS is enabled.
metatype.name: NIO for HTTPS

metatype.description: Absolute Path to the Keystore to use for HTTPS. Only used if HTTPS is enabled in which case this property is required.
metatype.name: Keystore

metatype.description: Password to access the Keystore. Only used if HTTPS is enabled.
metatype.name: Keystore Password

metatype.description: Password to unlock the secret key from the Keystore. Only used if HTTPS is enabled.
metatype.name: Key Password

metatype.description: Absolute Path to the Truststore to use for HTTPS. Only used if HTTPS is enabled.
metatype.name: Truststore

metatype.description: Password to access the Truststore. Only used if HTTPS is enabled.
metatype.name: Truststore Password

metatype.description: Requirement for the Client to provide a valid certifcate. Defaults to none.
metatype.name: Client Certificate

metatype.description: Whether to write DEBUG level messages or not. Defaults to false.
metatype.name: Debug Logging
Use the bundle activation policy when starting

metatype.description: Use name 'default' to change the default work queue settings
metatype.name: Name

metatype.description: List of key/value pairs where key is the file extension and value is the mime type, e.g., nitf=image/nitf
metatype.name: File Extensions to Mime Types

metatype.description: Shell command to be used within the container. For example, log:set DEBUG
metatype.name: Command

metatype.description: The interval of time in seconds between each execution. Must be a positive integer. For example, 3600 is 1 hour.
metatype.name: Interval in seconds

metatype.description: The OpenSearch endpoint URL or DDF's OpenSearch endpoint (http://0.0.0.0:8181/services/catalog/query?q={searchTerms}...)
metatype.name: OpenSearch service URL

metatype.description: Always performs a local query by setting src=local OpenSearch parameter in endpoint URL. This must be set if federating to another DDF.
metatype.name: Always perform local query.

metatype.description: Converts Polygon and Point-Radius searches to a Bounding Box for compatibility with older interfaces. Generated bounding box is a very rough representation of the input geometry.
metatype.name: Convert to BBox

metatype.description: Truststore is only required for secure OpenSearch endpoints
metatype.name: Truststore File Location

metatype.description: Keystore is only required for secure OpenSearch endpoints
metatype.name: Keystore File Location

metatype.description: The OpenSearch endpoint URL or DDF's OpenSearch endpoint (http://0.0.0.0:8181/services/catalog/query?q={searchTerms}...)
metatype.name: OpenSearch service URL

metatype.description: When federating with other DDFs, keep this checked. If checked, this source performs a local query on the remote site (by setting src=local in endpoint URL), as opposed to an enterprise search.
metatype.name: Always perform local query

metatype.description: Converts Polygon and Point-Radius searches to a Bounding Box for compatibility with older interfaces. Generated bounding box is a very rough representation of the input geometry.
metatype.name: Convert to BBox

metatype.description: Truststore is only required for secure OpenSearch endpoints
metatype.name: Truststore File Location

metatype.description: Keystore is only required for secure OpenSearch endpoints
metatype.name: Keystore File Location

metatype.description: Specifies the directory to be monitored
metatype.name: Directory Path

metatype.description: How ingested files are to be handled: Store Only = only store ingested file in DDF Content Repository; Process Only = only create catalog entry in Metadata Catalog for ingested file; Store and Process = do both
metatype.name: Processing Directive

metatype.description: Optional: Copy the ingested files into a backup directory under the monitored directory named /.ingested  -  NOTE: this will double the amount of disk space required for ingested files in this monitored directory if its Processing Directive includes storing the file in the DDF Content Repository.
metatype.name: Copy Files to Backup Directory

metatype.description: The name of the Metacard Attribute to match against. e.g. title, metadata-content-type, etc
metatype.name: Attribute Name

metatype.description: The value of the Metacard Attribute.
metatype.name: Attribute Value

metatype.description: The full qualified URL to the KML Style. e.g. http://example.com/styles#myStyle
metatype.name: Style URL
